docs.snippet: PROBABLE FALL OF NEW-ORLEANS.  The Government has no news of an attack upon New-Orleans or its defences, but such an attack is doubtless made.

docs.lead_paragraph: We print in another column a full copy of the Metropolitan Health bill, now pending in the Legislature. A synopsis of this act has already been published, but its importance and interest to all our citizens will warrant this publication of all its details.

docs.snippet: A few days since, the TIMES noted briefly a report presented at a meeting of the Commissioners of Health, by Dr. LEWIS A. SAYRE, Resident Physician, on the subject of compulsory vaccination. The report, of which a large number were ordered for...

headline.main: Compulsory Vaccinnation.; FRENCH EVANGELICAL CHURCH OF NEW-YORK

docs.abstract: Abstract of Dr. A Sayre report urging compulsory vaccination for NYC residents
docs.lead_paragraph: A few days since, the TIMES noted briefly a report presented at a meeting of the Commissioners of Health, by Dr. LEWIS A. SAYRE, Resident Physician, on the subject of compulsory vaccination. The report, of which a large number were ordered for gratuitous distribution, has just been printed, and in view of the magnitude of the public interests involved, we present a very full abstract.

docs.snippet: We receive from Washington the highly-import- ant intimation that New-Orleans is now in possession of the National forces. This is given as the prevalent opinion in naval and military circles.
docs.lead_paragraph: We receive from Washington the highly-import- ant intimation that New-Orleans is now in possession of the National forces. This is given as the prevalent opinion in naval and military circles.

headline.main: OUR HAVANA CORRESPONDENCE.; Arrival of the Blasco de Garay-Embarkation of the English Troops at Vera Cruz Disputes between the Allied Powers Reported Departure of the Captain-General -The Spanish Bank of Havana.

docs.lead_paragraph: The reports which have been in circulation here for same time that there was a disagreement between the three European Powers on the Mexican question, have at last been confirmed. The Spanish steamer-of- war Blasco de Garay arrived on Thursday afternoon the l3th Inst., from Vera Cruz, at 2 o'clock P.M., after a voyage of six days.
